episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the peculiar habits of historical rugby players, the challenges faced by the first woman in space, the unique customs of the Toda society in India, and the surprising coincidences in George Lucas's life related to the Lucas Valley.

facts.fact: The 1890s Irish rugby captain, D.B. Walkington, would play wearing a monocle, but he took it out if he had to tackle anyone.
The engineers who sent the first woman into space forgot to give her two things: one, a toothbrush, and two, the ability to return back to Earth.
In the Toda Society of Southern India, milkmen are not allowed to have sex.
George Lucas owns four ranches in the Lucas Valley, which is named after a completely different Lucas.
